channel.title: Bloomberg Markets

item.title: Republicans Inch Closer to a SALT Cap Compromise
item.description: House Republicans could reach a agreement on the state and local tax deduction as soon as Wednesday, according to Speaker Mike Johnson. Tyler Kendall reports on Bloomberg Television.

item.title: Stocks Churn as Rally Shows Fatigue; Dollar Drops: Markets Wrap
item.description: US stock futures and Treasuries posted small moves, with investors signaling that the equity rally is losing momentum as it stretches into a fourth week. The dollar fell.
item.dc:creator: Margaryta Kirakosian, Sujata Rao

media:content.media:description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Alix Steel, Scarlet Fu, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec.

item.title: Saudi Arabia Cutting AI Chip Deals With US Big Tech
item.description: Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates are poised to win wider access to advanced AI chips from Nvidia Corp. and Advanced Micro Devices Inc. under agreements with the US expected to be unveiled in coming days. Peter Elstrom reports on Bloomberg Television.

item.title: Markets Not All Clear as Rally Signifies: State Street
item.description: Marvin Loh, senior global macro strategist at State Street, questions whether the market rally “should be as broad based as it is,” but says there is an opportunity to continue to build on risk.

item.title: Bloomberg Intelligence Presentation
item.description: Bloomberg Intelligence's Tomasz Noetzel presents on AI vs. Banks: Seizing $180 Billion Opportunity or Hype at the Winning the Innovation Game: Modernizing IT Without Disruption event in New York. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Rocket Software Sponsor Spotlight
item.description: Ranjita Iyer, Executive Vice President, NAM Services, Mastercard; Patricia Voight, Chief Information Security Officer, Webster Bank; and Larry Zelvin, Executive Vice President & Head of Financial Crimes Unit, BMO Financial Group speak with Bloomberg's Diksha Gera about how new technologies help to protect against fraud and minimize risk at Winning the Innovation Game: Modernizing IT Without Disruption event in New York. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Mastercard, BMO and Webster Bank on Securing Data
item.description: Ranjita Iyer, Executive Vice President, NAM Services, Mastercard; Patricia Voight, Chief Information Security Officer, Webster Bank; and Larry Zelvin, Executive Vice President & Head of Financial Crimes Unit, BMO Financial Group speak with Bloomberg's Diksha Gera about how new techologies help to protect against fraud and minimize risk at Winning the Innovation Game: Modernizing IT Without Disruption event in New York. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Amex CTO Hilary Packer on AI Strategy
item.description: American Express Executive Vice President & Chief Technology Officer Hilary Packer discusses her strategy for continuous modernization to prepare for a digital future with Bloomberg's Lisa Mateo at the Winning the Innovation Game: Modering IT Without Disruption event in New York. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: PGIM, Zurich North America and Fifth Third Bancorp on AI
item.description: Mike Baker, Senior Vice President, Chief Information & Technology Officer, PGIM; Kristen Bessette, Chief Data Officer, Zurich North America; and Jude Schramm, Executive Vice President & Chief Information Officer, Fifth Third Bancorp speak with Bloomberg's Niraj Patel about how AI is driving innovation and transforming industries at the Winning the Innovation Game: Modernizing IT Without Disruption event in New York. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US-Korea Currency Talks Fuel Bets Trump Is Open to Weaker Dollar
item.description: The dollar fell after a person familiar with the matter said the US and South Korean governments discussed currency policies this month, fanning speculation President Donald Trump’s administration is open to a weaker greenback and will make exchange rates a feature of upcoming trade talks.
item.dc:creator: Daedo Kim, Jaehyun Eom

media:content.media:description: US dollar banknote and South Korean won.

item.title: Namibia Plans Renewable Power Build in Strategy to Cut Imports
item.description: Namibia plans to add 93 megawatts of renewable energy capacity during the financial year ending 2026 as part of a strategy to reduce electricity imports.
item.dc:creator: Kaula Nhongo

media:content.media:description: An array of solar panels at a green hydrogen plant in Namibia.

item.title: Sale of Portugal’s Novo Banco Revive Fears of Spanish Dominance
item.description: Eight years after Portugal agreed to sell the remnants of what was once the country’s largest lender to Lone Star Funds, plans by the US investor to sell Novo Banco are reviving deep-seated fears in the country.
item.dc:creator: Henrique Almeida

media:content.media:description: A Novo Banco SA bank branch in Lisbon. Photographer: Goncalo Fonseca/Bloomberg

item.title: Hapag-Lloyd: Huge Surge in Volume in the Last Couple of Days
item.description: Hapag-Lloyd CEO Rolf Habben Jansen on the impact of the trade deal between US and China. He speaks with Bloomberg's Guy Johnson, Anna Edwards and Kriti Gupta on 'The Opening Trade'. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Credit Suisse Bankers Shouldn’t Have Been Stripped of Bonuses, Court Says
item.description: A dozen former Credit Suisse bankers were unlawfully stripped of their bonuses when UBS Group AG bought its collapsing rival, a Swiss court said in a verdict that could pave the way for fresh lawsuits from hundreds more employees over unpaid compensation.
item.dc:creator: Hugo Miller

media:content.media:description: A Credit Suisse sign in a branch of UBS in Basel.

item.title: India’s Shapoorji Nears Record $3.4 Billion Private Credit Deal
item.description: Privately-held Indian conglomerate Shapoorji Pallonji Group is aiming to sign a $3.4 billion debt deal as early as Wednesday evening, in what would be the country’s biggest ever private credit deal, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Saikat Das, Nic Querolo

item.title: Wall Street Is Warming to Small Caps and Other Laggards
item.description: Traders are trying to catch up to the latest rally
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton, Phil Serafino

item.title: Chinese Builder Vanke Repays Its Only Dollar Bond Due This Year
item.description: China Vanke Co. has wired funds to repay a dollar bond due on Monday, according to people familiar with the matter, clearing its only such obligation of the year after a government-led overhaul of the developer.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Emma Dong, Jackie Cai

media:content.media:description: Residential buildings under construction at the China Vanke Co. Isle Maison development in Shanghai.

item.title: TotalEnergies to Sell 50% Stake in Polish Biogas Unit to HitecVision
item.description: TotalEnergies SE agreed to sell a 50% stake in its Polish biogas production business to Norwegian investment firm HitecVision AS as part of the oil major’s strategy to boost return on its renewables investments.
item.dc:creator: Francois De Beaupuy

media:content.media:description: A logo on the exterior of the TotalEnergies SE headquarters in Paris. Photographer: Benjamin Girette/Bloomberg

item.title: Citi, JPMorgan See 2025’s Laggards Turning Short-Term Winners
item.description: Two of Wall Street’s major trading desks are making the same bold call on US stocks as trade tensions ease: Pile into this year’s biggest losers for quick, short-term profits.
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton

item.title: Oil Holds Four-Day Gain Spurred by Trade Optimism, Iran Friction
item.description: Oil held the bulk of its biggest four-day rally since October, spurred by the US-China trade détente and President Donald Trump’s hostile rhetoric on Iranian supply.
item.dc:creator: Alex Longley, Sarah Chen

media:content.media:description: A gas flare burns from a pipe aboard an offshore oil platform in the Persian Gulf's Salman Oil Field, operated by the National Iranian Offshore Oil Co., near Lavan island, Iran, on Thursday, Jan. 5. 2017. Nov. 5 is the day when sweeping U.S. sanctions on Iran’s energy and banking sectors go back into effect after Trump’s decision in May to walk away from the six-nation deal with Iran that suspended them. Photographer: Ali Mohammadi/Bloomberg

item.title: CATL Guides IPO Price at Top End in World's Biggest Listing of 2025
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. is set to raise at least $4 billion in its Hong Kong share listing by pricing it at the top end of what it indicated, according to people familiar with the matter, thanks to strong demand for the stock.
item.dc:creator: Dave Sebastian, Julia Fioretti

item.title: Yuan Is Set to Gain Versus Dollar, Goldman Sachs Says
item.description: Kamakshya Trivedi, head of global FX, rates and emerging-market strategy at Goldman Sachs, discusses the outlook for the dollar against Asian currencies including the yuan. "We think the CNY is going to appreciate versus the dollar going forward," Trivedi tells Bloomberg Television. "That's an important anchor for global foreign exchange markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Gold Edges Lower as Traders Assess Trade Talks, Fed Outlook
item.description: Gold edged lower for the second time in three days as traders assess softer-than-expected US inflation figures for April and cooling trade tensions with China.
item.dc:creator: Sybilla Gross, Yihui Xie, Jack Ryan

media:content.media:description: A one-hundred gram gold bar sits on a one kilogram gold bar at Gold Investments Ltd. bullion dealers in this arranged photograph in London, U.K., on Wednesday, July 29, 2020. Gold held its ground after a record-setting rally as investors awaited the outcome of a Federal Reserve meeting amid expectations policy makers will remain dovish, potentially spurring more gains. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg

item.title: India Is Now Most Favored Asian Stock Market, BofA Survey Shows
item.description: India has replaced Japan as fund managers’ top Asian stock market pick, as the South Asian nation is likely to benefit from supply chain shifts amid global trade tensions, according to BofA Securities’ latest monthly survey.
item.dc:creator: Chiranjivi Chakraborty

media:content.media:description: The National Stock Exchange in Mumbai.

item.title: Julius Baer Ordered to Pay $5 Million Over Money Laundering Case
item.description: Julius Baer Group Ltd. has been ordered to hand over 4.4 million Swiss francs ($5.2 million) including confiscated profits linked to alleged failures in money laundering controls, in a fresh setback for the bank’s newly installed management team.
item.dc:creator: Noele Illien

media:content.media:description: A Julius Baer Group Ltd. branch in Zurich. Photographer: Stefan Wermuth/Bloomberg

item.title: Sony Sees $700 Million Tariff Hit on Underwhelming Outlook
item.description: Sony Group Corp. offered an underwhelming forecast for the year ahead, with the burden of US tariffs wiping out expectations for an increase in operating profit.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Furukawa, Takashi Mochizuki

media:content.media:description: The Sony PlayStation 5 Pro controller. Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: Hong Kong Tycoon Lau Selling $4.5 Million Wine Collection
item.description: Hong Kong billionaire Joseph Lau is selling another wine collection with an estimated value exceeding HK$35 million ($4.5 million) in an auction by Christie’s next week.
item.dc:creator: Venus Feng

item.title: Pfizer Back to Euro Market Amid Record Spree of US Issuers
item.description: Pfizer Inc. is selling its first euro bonds in seven years, joining a record spree of reverse Yankee bond issuance.
item.dc:creator: Ronan Martin

media:content.media:description: A Pfizer research and manufacturing site in Andover, Massachusetts, US.

item.title: M&G Sees Opportunity to Buy Tech Stocks on Dips
item.description: M&G Investments' Fabiana Fedeli discusses buying risk assets as traders await fresh catalysts for the rally that erased the S&P 500’s losses in 2025 amid a US-China trade truce and reignited demand for technology shares. "The US exceptionalism is true and is very clear when it comes to innovation," Fedeli tells Bloomberg Television. "We have started buying into technology stocks when we saw the big selloff." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Chinese Stocks Advance on Growing Optimism Over Tech Earnings
item.description: Chinese shares rose before earnings announcements by key tech firms, with sentiment also boosted by a positive report on Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.’s offering.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Kelly Li, Lin Zhu

media:content.media:description: A statue of a bull at the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in Shenzhen. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg
